product_name: Laura MercierTinted Moisturizer Light Revealer Natural Skin Illuminator Broad Spectrum SPF 25
summary: SummaryReveal your luminosity with Laura Mercier's secret to "no makeup" makeup, the Tinted Moisturizer Light Revealer Natural Skin Illuminator. This ultra-sheer, flexible formula is infused with complexion-boosting pearls developed specifically for each shade to boost skin's natural radiance.

reviews.headline: Hot Pearly Mess
reviews.comments:
This is the worst. 
Your whole face ends up looking like you lost a bad fight with a pearly highlighter. It's entirely unflattering. 
Bring back the original tinted moisturizer in 2n1. There's a reason it was a best seller for decades.
Returned.

reviews.headline: Again and again I LOVE  this
reviews.comments: This product is amazing I feel like I'm wearing Nothing

reviews.headline: Nice product, change in color option
reviews.comments:
I have used Laura Mercier Tinted Moisturizer for several years and really like it because I don't need a foundation but do want something to even out my complexion and want to be sure to have sunscreen.  It is not my primary moisturizer.  My last order the product changed to Light Reveler Natural Skin Illuminator which I like however, the color 1N2 Vanille, that was perfect for me is no longer available.  Cameo is a bit lighter and I feel a bit washed out with it.  
Hope Laura Mercier considers bringing back Vanille.

reviews.headline: Love this so much!!
reviews.comments: This is a medium consistency. Not too heavy and not watery. Perfect texture and blend! Feels super light and clean while wearing!! I still have to wear a little concealer due to dark circles but overall a great product!

reviews.headline: Please keep in stock!
reviews.comments: This is a great foundation with nice coverage without looking chalky or caked. I love how it brings light to my face!

reviews.headline: Best tinted moisturizer with sunscreen
reviews.comments: This is the best lightweight, but yet Buildable coverage that moisturizes with sunscreen!!

reviews.headline: The only coverage-ish product I have for yeas
reviews.comments: This is the best product. I have very fair skin with a warm undertone and it's hard to find very fair products that aren't cool toned or neutral... the shade Pearl is perfect. This is light coverage, so natural, gives a glass skin look!

reviews.headline: Love this product
reviews.comments: Awesome product for everyday natural look

reviews.headline: NEVER BUY THIS
reviews.comments: Please never buy. Received one year expired offered countless questions to verify I really bought this to obtain a refund on product that will cause allergic reaction

reviews.headline: my everyday go to
reviews.comments:
Im at that age where all the lines and discoloration from sun damage is catching up on me and you wouldnt know it with this.

pretty sheer and melts right into the skin rather than sit ON the skin.

makes the skin look vibrant and healthy and diflects just enough light to help distract from the lines.

you can build it up some but you wont get more than an almost medium coverage no matter how much you add but it will also not cake up no matter how much you build it. stays pretty well, ladting all day with a good primer and setting spray

this is my go to everyday. the only exception is when I need a full coverage.

price point is pretty good for what you are getting. I think Ive purchased it about 8 times

reviews.headline: Makes me cry
reviews.comments: I dint know why but anytime I wear this, its very irritating to my eyes and I spend all day tearing up. I loathe this product

reviews.headline: One of the worst  purchase I have made
reviews.comments: Horrible. I thought at first I was utilizing this product wrong. I tried it many diffrent ways. Nope. It clings to your skin to make it look patchy. Pores I didn't even knew I had are visible  when this is worn. As well as giving weird dry spots that I dont have only when wearing this. I have normal combo.

reviews.headline: Honestly sucks
reviews.comments: This is one of the worst products I have ever tried. If you like the pilling you get when you apply water based foundation to a silicone based primer, then you'd love this…. Jk. I tried applying this with bare skin on moisturizer, on primer, I've tried it alone with no product. It doesn't settle into the skin and moved around, it's splotchy, it's uneven. I've tried using hands, sponges, and brushes. The only way this product looks good is if you apply it in the dark. Will be returning this. I have NEVER left a bad review before, but this definitely deserves it.

reviews.headline: Makes you cry (for more than 1 reason)
reviews.comments: I cannot even start with how disappointed i am in this product. I had so much more faith in laura mercier. This product lays horribly on my face making my bumps look bigger and more noticeable. On top of that it moves during the day and reliably makes me cry after 6 hours of wear or even sooner if im smiling a lot and squinting my eyes. I am careful to not put it too close to my undereyes but it still moves up. The skin illuminator does not make me glow. I am so disappointed in this product i had such higher hopes. The only good thing is the spf in it, but at the same time thats probably what makes me cry. It stings so badly.

reviews.headline: Bizarre product
reviews.comments: Impossible to blend in. This pills, chunks, clumps, and smears. No matter which method I use to apply it, it won't go on smooth. If I use my fingers you can see smears. If I use a blender you can see clumps. If I use a brush you can see pilling, and so on. It won't adhere. I've tried using a moisturizer under it, a primer, and just going bare skinned. Makes no difference. It also clumps very badly to the very fine peach fuzz I have on the sides of my face. I don't understand why it won't just SIT on my face. Every time I try this I have to wipe it off and start over with something different. So frustrating! I've never had this experience with a sunblock or a foundation.

reviews.headline: Mixed Feelings
reviews.comments: I recently purchased this product because it was half off. I don't dislike it but would never pay full price for it. I have many tinted moisturizers and this is far from the best I've used. It is not terribly hydrating and feels a bit sticky and heavy when first applied. There is zero coverage as it is extremely sheer and it is not easy to blend. It is probably not great for someone with large pores as it can show texture. All that said, it does give the skin a beautiful, soft illuminating effect on well prepped skin. There is a diverse shade selection and I got a good match for my skintone. I think it is overpriced for what it is but at 50% off it was worth trying. I think  I will probably keep it but it's definitely not for everyone.

reviews.headline: I would buy this again!
reviews.comments: I LOVE this product! The illumination leaves you with a nice glow. Not too sparkly or shiny.

reviews.headline: Better products out there
reviews.comments: Purchased becasue it was half off and i love tinted moisturizer; but this is going to be returned. It has more cons than pros in my opinion.

reviews.headline: Perfect
reviews.comments: I have dry skin all year round and usually am picky with tinted moisturizers. Goes on so easily and is very hydrating. Product feels so light. Also love that it does not give me that white cast look. I love it.

reviews.headline: Not what I was expecting
reviews.comments: I really hated this so called moisturizer! This is my first time using tinted moisturizer so I was expecting this to be more like a true moisturizer with some tint added to it. This is just like liquid foundation in a tube. There's absolutely no moisturizing effect to this at all. My hands were completely orange. I hated this product. Such a disappointment for something so expensive.

media.headline: Leaves a gross layer on skin that doesn't blend

faceoff_positive.comments: I have absolutely fallen in love with this! It gives such a nice, radiant finish. My skin looks flawless when I wear it, without looking cakey. I love that it has SPF in it and that it is also moisturizing. This would be my go to for everyday wear if I was able to wear makeup everyday. I am in healthcare and have to wear an N95 everyday, but hoping that some day I will be able to actually put on makeup for work again! If and when that happens, I will definitely be reaching for this product. The first time I used it, I attempted to use a beautyblender but found that using my hands was easier and didn't waste so much product. It is pretty liquid-y, so the blender just soaked up too much. I basically just apply it like I would a moisturized. I just can't get over how pretty the finish is, and I don't notice that it accentuates texture like some products with this finish do. It is almost like this product has some kind of micro-glitter in it to give it such a pretty glow"¦makes me think of the glow that vampires have in the sunlight in Twilight (I'm dating myself). Anyways, this is an amazing lightweight face product that makes your skin look beautiful and you won't regret buying. I love the shade range available as well. I will say that I tried this over the Laura Mercier Blurring Pure Canvas Primer and it was a disaster, so don't do that! But that primer is garbage anyway imo, it doesn't matter what foundation product you use with it. Not sure about the other primera in that line though, as I have only tried the blurring finish.
faceoff_positive.headline: such a pretty finish

faceoff_negative.comments: Cameo Fair with Pink Undertones: I feel kind of bad giving such a poor review, but if I'd paid full price for this I would have been SO disappointed. There's essentially no coverage. It's a sheer wash of color - in my case the wrong color which is likely adding to why I dislike it so much. I think I needed "Petal" which is neutral because, even though I believe I have cool undertones, Cameo didn't work on my skin tone. Despite the sheerness (it will not cover any redness or imperfections and almost makes any bumps or blemishes stand out more due to the shimmer), it's still hard to apply evenly. I normally use fingers for a tinted moisturizer but this is super streaky that way. A sponge works better but eats up product. With a tinted moisturizer I normally don't set it, if you don't this can get shinier and shinier as the day goes on due to the sheerness & shimmer. (Pro: it's light and feels nice on my face) When trying to make it work (as I've been testing it for a few weeks) I just end up adding way too much other makeup - concealer, blush, bronzer, etc and don't end up liking the overall look much. (I've dyed my hair back to dark brunette since the photos and this still isn't working out well with my coloring.) I do like the spf & the packaging. Others have mentioned the smell, that's not a huge deal to me, it smells like sunscreen but doesn't linger after application in my opinion. If you have flawless skin & are just looking for a some extra spf coverage and a glow this might be great for you for Spring & fall! I don't feel it would perform well in summer, but that's when this may end up actually matching my skin. Not every product will work well for every person and this just didn't work well for me right now. I might try it again later if my skin texture clears up a bit more, as it tends to in summer. Photos show same day and lighting with no makeup and then with only this product on right after application, then with a full face of makeup. I didn't have any red marks or anything to cover that day, but if you do this will not cover them at all - at least in my shade Cameo.
faceoff_negative.headline: No coverage, Very Glowy
